title: Automakers move to adopt a circular economy - Economist Intelligence Unit
summary: Several automakers are trying to develop circularity in vehicle production, allowing them to reuse materials and resources to reduce waste. In November, Renault announced that it will split its business into five units, one of which will focus on the circular economy and aims to achieve closed-loop circularity across the vehicle life-cycle. Stellantis has also announced plans for the launch of its circular economy business unit and aims to generate about â‚¬2bn in revenue from the unit.
green_innovation: TRUE, because the article describes innovations in vehicle production that contribute to environmental sustainability goals, such as reducing waste and conserving resources.
business_innovation: TRUE, because the article describes new or improved products and processes in vehicle production, such as Renault's closed-loop battery recycling plant and Stellantis's concept electric vehicle made from recycled material.
green_product: TRUE, because the article describes products in vehicle production that are designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces their environmental impact, such as Stellantis's concept electric vehicle made from recycled material.
green_process: TRUE, because the article describes processes in vehicle production that minimize environmental impacts and promote sustainability, such as Renault's closed-loop battery recycling plant.
likely_naics_codes: ['336312 - Motor Vehicle Body Manufacturing', '336322 - Motor Vehicle Transmission and Power Train Parts Manufacturing', '336399 - All Other Motor Vehicle Parts Manufacturing', '562112 - Solid Waste Collection']
greenwashing: The article does not provide evidence that the described product or process innovation is an example of greenwashing.

title: How businesses can implement the Global Biodiversity Framework - World Economic Forum
summary: The Global Biodiversity Framework (GBF) aims to conserve nature and ensure its sustainable use, and businesses can contribute by assessing and disclosing their impact, reducing negative impacts, increasing positive impacts, being inclusive and just, and collaborating with others.
green_innovation: TRUE, because it contributes to environmental sustainability goals by reducing negative environmental externalities.
business_innovation: TRUE, because it involves new or improved products or business processes that differ significantly from the company's previous products or business processes.
green_product: TRUE, because it is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: TRUE, because it minimizes environmental impacts and promotes sustainability by reducing waste, conserving natural resources, decreasing energy consumption, and limiting the release of harmful substances into the environment.

title: Mars Wrigley China Launches First Package Containing 100% rPET in a Local Chocolate Brand - Cui Xiang Mi - PR Newswire
summary: Mars Wrigley China has launched its first package containing recycled PET (rPET) in the Chinese market via a local chocolate brand, Cui Xiang Mi (CXM). The new 216g canister lid of CXM is made from 100% rPET, demonstrating a new chapter in recycled contents application for Mars Wrigley China's package portfolio. Mars Wrigley China has also released a range of diverse sustainable packaging solutions in the past three years, including package weight lightening projects, new sustainable materials application, and new business models based on sustainability purpose.
green_innovation: TRUE, the article describes the development of a new chocolate canister lid made from 100% recycled PET (rPET), which reduces carbon emissions and petroleum consumption and contributes to a circular economy.
business_innovation: TRUE, the article describes the development of a new chocolate canister lid made from 100% recycled PET (rPET), which is a new or improved product that differs significantly from the firm's previous products and has been introduced on the market.
green_product: TRUE, the article describes the development of a new chocolate canister lid made from 100% recycled PET (rPET), which is a good that is designed, manufactured, and used in a way that significantly reduces its environmental impact throughout its life cycle.
green_process: FALSE, the article does not describe a new or improved business process.
product_or_process: chocolate canister lid made from 100% recycled PET (rPET)

greenwashing: FALSE, the article does not describe a product or process innovation that is an example of greenwashing.
